Module org.microbean.type
Package org.microbean.type

Class JavaTypes

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.JavaTypes
public final class JavaTypes extends Object
A utility class providing useful operations related to Java Types.
Author:
Laird Nelson

    static final Map<Type,Class<?>>

    • boxedTypes

      public static final Map<Type,Class<?>> boxedTypes
      An immutable Map of Java wrapper classes indexed by their primitive equivalents.

  • Method Details

    • box

      public static final Type box(Type type)
      Returns the supplied Type if it is not a Class or if it is not primitive, or a boxed type representing it.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type; must not be null
      Returns:
      a boxed representation of the supplied Type, or the Type itself
      See Also:
      • boxedTypes
      Idempotency:
      This method is deterministic, but not necessarily idempotent.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • assignable

      @Convenience public static final boolean assignable(Type receiverType, Type payloadType)
      Returns true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadType is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied receiverType, according to the assignability rules modeled by the Type.CovariantSemantics class.

      This method calls Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type) with the supplied arguments and returns the result.

      Parameters:
      receiverType - the receiver type as described above; must not be null
      payloadType - the payload type as described above; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadType is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the Type.CovariantSemantics class
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either receiverType or payloadType is null
      See Also:
      • Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • assignable

      @Convenience public static final boolean assignable(Type receiverType, Type payloadType, boolean box)
      Returns true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadType is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied receiverType, according to the assignability rules modeled by the Type.CovariantSemantics class.

      This method calls Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type, boolean) with the supplied arguments and returns the result.

      Parameters:
      receiverType - the receiver type as described above; must not be null
      payloadType - the payload type as described above; must not be null
      box - whether autoboxing is enabled
      Returns:
      true if and only if a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied payloadType is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the Type.CovariantSemantics class
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either receiverType or payloadType is null
      See Also:
      • Type.Semantics.assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • emptyTypeArray

      public static final Type[] emptyTypeArray()
      Returns a Type array with a length of 0.
      Returns:
      a Type array with a length of 0
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • directSupertypes

      public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(Type type)
      Returns the direct supertypes of the supplied Type, provided that it is either a Class, a ParameterizedType, a GenericArrayType or a TypeVariable.

      The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type itself.

      The returned Collection will contain no duplicate elements but is not guaranteed to be a Set implementation.

      Parameters:
      type - the Type to introspect; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Collection of the direct supertypes of the supplied type; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a Class and not a ParameterizedType and not a GenericArrayType and not a TypeVariable
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • directSupertypes

      public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(Type type, Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate)
      Returns the direct supertypes of the supplied Type, provided that it is either a Class, a ParameterizedType, a GenericArrayType or a TypeVariable.

      The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type itself.

      The returned Collection will contain no duplicate elements but is not guaranteed to be a Set implementation.

      Parameters:
      type - the Type to introspect; must not be null
      acceptancePredicate - a Predicate controlling membership of a Type in the returned Collection; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Collection of the direct supertypes of the supplied type; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either type or acceptancePredicate is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a Class and not a ParameterizedType and not a GenericArrayType and not a TypeVariable
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertypes

      public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(Type type)
      Returns the supertypes of the supplied Type, provided that it is either a Class, a ParameterizedType, a GenericArrayType or a TypeVariable.

      The supertypes of a type include the type itself.

      The returned Collection will contain no duplicate elements but is not guaranteed to be a Set implementation.

      Parameters:
      type - the Type to introspect; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Collection of the supertypes of the supplied type; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a Class and not a ParameterizedType and not a GenericArrayType and not a TypeVariable
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertypes

      public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(Type type, Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate)
      Returns the supertypes of the supplied Type, provided that it is either a Class, a ParameterizedType, a GenericArrayType or a TypeVariable.

      The supertypes of a type include the type itself.

      The returned Collection will contain no duplicate elements but is not guaranteed to be a Set implementation.

      Parameters:
      type - the Type to introspect; must not be null
      acceptancePredicate - a Predicate controlling membership of a Type in the returned Collection; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Collection of the supertypes of the supplied type; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either type or acceptancePredicate is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a Class and not a ParameterizedType and not a GenericArrayType and not a TypeVariable
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertype

      public static final boolean supertype(Type sup, Type sub)
      Returns true if and only if sup is a supertype of sub.

      This method obeys the subtyping rules from the Java Language Specification with the following exceptions:

      • Containing types are discarded when calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.
      • Primitive types have no supertypes.
      Parameters:
      sup - the purported supertype; must not be null
      sub - the purported subtype; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if sup is a supertype of sub
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either argument is null
      See Also:
      • supertypes(Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertype

      public static final boolean supertype(Type sup, Type sub, Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate)
      Returns true if and only if sup is a supertype of sub.

      This method obeys the subtyping rules from the Java Language Specification with the following exceptions:

      • Containing types are discarded when calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.
      • Primitive types have no supertypes.
      Parameters:
      sup - the purported supertype; must not be null
      sub - the purported subtype; must not be null
      acceptancePredicate - a Predicate controlling which supertypes are considered in this method's calculation; may be null in which case all supertypes will be considered
      Returns:
      true if and only if sup is a supertype of sub
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either sup or sub is null
      See Also:
      • supertypes(Type, Predicate)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • erase

      public static final Class<?> erase(Type type)
      Returns the type erasure for the supplied Type according to the rules of the Java Language Specification, section 4.6.
      • If null is supplied, null is returned.
      • If a Class is supplied, the Class is returned.
      • If a ParameterizedType is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its raw type is returned.
      • If a GenericArrayType is supplied, the result of invoking Object.getClass() on an invocation of Array.newInstance(Class, int) with the return value of an invocation of erase(Type) on its generic component type and 0 as its arguments is returned.
      • If a TypeVariable is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its first (leftmost) bound is returned (if it has one) or Object.class if it does not. Any other bounds are ignored.
      • If a WildcardType is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its first upper bound is returned. Any other bounds are ignored.
      • If any other Type implementation is supplied, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type for which the corresponding type erasure is to be returned; may be null in which case null will be returned
      Returns:
      a Class, or null if a suitable Class-typed type erasure could not be determined, indicating that the type erasure is the supplied Type itself
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method may return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple threads.

    • equals

      public static final boolean equals(Type type0, Type type1)
      Tests two Types for equality in a manner that is independent of their implementations.
      Parameters:
      type0 - the first Type; may be null
      type1 - the second Type; may be null
      Returns:
      true if the two Types are equal; false otherwise
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • hashCode

      public static final int hashCode(Type type)
      Computes and returns a hashcode for the supplied Type independent of its implementation.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type in question; may be null in which case 0 will be returned
      Returns:
      a hashcode for the supplied Type
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • toString

      public static final String toString(Type type)
      Returns a String representation of the supplied Type that is independent of its implementation.

      This method never returns null.

      Parameters:
      type - the Type in question; may be null in which case "null" will be returned
      Returns:
      a non-null String representation of the supplied Type
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • describeConstable

      public static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(Type type)
      Returns an Optional containing the nominal descriptor in the form of a ConstantDesc for the supplied Type, or an empty Optional if there is no such descriptor.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type in question; must be either null, a ConstantDesc itself, a Constable, a ParameterizedType, a GenericArrayType, a TypeVariable or a WildcardType
      Returns:
      an Optional as described above; never null
      See Also:
      • Constable
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
